title: Josh McDaniels, Patriots QB coach setting the bar high for an improved Drake Maye in 2025
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Josh McDaniels and Ashton Grant have set high expectations for Patriots quarterback Drake Maye in the 2025 season.
McDaniels praises Maye's hard work and growth, especially in pre-snap responsibilities, as the season opener approaches.
Maye aims to improve on a 2024 season where he had 2,276 passing yards, 15 touchdowns, and 10 interceptions.

title: More brands added to radioactive shrimp recall
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: FDA recalls potentially radioactive shrimp sold under various brands including Southwind Foods in Massachusetts and nine other states.
Recalled shrimp includes Southwind Foods, AquaStar cocktail shrimp, and Kroger Mercado shrimp, sold in selected states excluding Massachusetts.
Shrimp contamination involves Cesium-137 from Indonesia; FDA advises disposal or return of affected products for refunds.

title: Photos released of suspect who allegedly blew up ATM in Woburn
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: FBI seeks a suspect who allegedly used explosives on a drive-through ATM in Woburn's Eastern Bank Thursday morning.
Photos show a masked man in a dark shirt and backpack, caught on camera damaging the ATM with a possible pipe bomb.
No injuries occurred; FBI and police are investigating. Public safety is not at risk, but tips are encouraged.

title: 10 bold predictions for the 2025 Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is key for the Patriots' playoff hopes, projected to record 30 total touchdowns this season.
Mike Vrabel joins as head coach amid major roster changes after back-to-back four-win seasons for the Patriots.
K'Lavon Chaisson expected to be the standout defensive acquisition with a potential double-digit sack total.

title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: In 2020, Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders as a quarterback but team leadership chose a different direction.
Brady later became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, holding a 10 percent stake in the team.
Under revised NFL rules, Brady can now attend production meetings for FOX but cannot visit teams' facilities while broadcasting.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship,' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd, is available on HBO Max.
'Highest 2 Lowest,' Spike Lee's remake featuring Denzel Washington, streams on Apple TV+.
'The Paper,' a spinoff of 'The Office,' is streaming on Peacock.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Raiders will visit the Patriots with Mike Vrabel as the new Patriots head coach.
Jakobi Meyers looks forward to returning to Foxborough as a Raider, separating emotions from on-field play.
Raiders HC Pete Carroll and OC Chip Kelly emphasize the Patriots' strong front seven in their game plan.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and IShowSpeed toured Boston, recreating the Boston Tea Party by dumping tea into the water.
Brown and IShowSpeed participated in several activities, including Muay Thai and a race at Downtown Crossing.
Despite narrowly losing the race, Brown contested IShowSpeed's victory, humorously suggesting name change consequences on social media.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell is set to make his NFL debut for the Patriots against the Raiders, pending ankle injury status.
Dante Scarnecchia praised Campbell's dynamic blocking, despite his arm length being questioned for NFL suitability.
Campbell was the only NFL rookie lineman graded above 80 in both pass and run blocking during preseason.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: UNC coach Bill Belichick has banned Patriots scouts from attending practices and games, citing past treatment by the team.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated the ban is Belichick's prerogative and the team will find other scouting methods.
Bill Belichick joined UNC after being fired from the Patriots in 2023 following three losing seasons and a strained relationship with owner Robert Kraft.
